3.6.1.title: Kill Line Purpose
3.6.1.content:
**Function:**
Provides pathway to pump into the well below closed BOP:
- Bullheading operations
- Pumping kill mud into annulus
- Alternative circulation path
- Lubricate and bleed operations

**Location:**
- Connection on BOP stack, below rams
- Routes to kill manifold/pump
- Must be accessible and functional

3.6.2.title: Kill Line Components
3.6.2.content:
**From BOP to Surface:**
- BOP kill outlet
- Kill line (high pressure rated)
- Isolation valves
- Check valve (prevents backflow to pump)
- Connection to kill manifold or pump

**Pressure Rating:**
- Match BOP working pressure
- All components rated accordingly
- Verify during testing

3.6.3.title: Kill Pump Options
3.6.3.content:
**Rig Pumps:**
- Can pump through standpipe to drillstring
- Or route to kill line for annulus injection
- Standard for most kill operations

**Cementing Unit:**
- High pressure capability
- Can be used for bullheading
- Alternative if rig pumps insufficient

**Dedicated Kill Pump:**
- Some operations have dedicated high-pressure pump
- Provides redundancy
- May be required for high-pressure operations

**Capacity:**
- Must be able to pump at required rate
- Must achieve required pressure
- Consider pump horsepower and rating

3.6.4.title: Testing Kill System
3.6.4.content:
**Pressure Test:**
- Kill line to working pressure
- Include all valves and connections
- Test from BOP to manifold

**Function Test:**
- Verify valves operate
- Check valve function (holds one direction)
- Pump connectivity verified

**Circulation Test:**
- May include circulation through kill line
- Verify no obstructions
- Confirm routing correct

**Documentation:**
- Record all tests
- Note any issues
- Include in BOP test documentation
